00029 struct  btOverlapCallback
00030 {
00031         virtual ~btOverlapCallback()
00032         {}
00033         //return true for deletion of the pair
00034         virtual bool    processOverlap(btBroadphasePair& pair) = 0;
00035 
00036 };
00037 
00038 struct btOverlapFilterCallback
00039 {
00040         virtual ~btOverlapFilterCallback()
00041         {}
00042         // return true when pairs need collision
00043         virtual bool    needBroadphaseCollision(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0,btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1) const = 0;
00044 };

00056 const int BT_NULL_PAIR=0xffffffff;

00094 ATTRIBUTE_ALIGNED16(class) btHashedOverlappingPairCache : public btOverlappingPairCache
00095 {
00096         btBroadphasePairArray   m_overlappingPairArray;
00097         btOverlapFilterCallback* m_overlapFilterCallback;
00098 
00099 protected:
00100         
00101         btAlignedObjectArray<int>       m_hashTable;
00102         btAlignedObjectArray<int>       m_next;
00103         btOverlappingPairCallback*      m_ghostPairCallback;
00104 
00105 
00106 public:
00107         BT_DECLARE_ALIGNED_ALLOCATOR();
00108         
00109         btHashedOverlappingPairCache();
00110         virtual ~btHashedOverlappingPairCache();
00111 
00112         
00113         void    removeOverlappingPairsContainingProxy(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy,btDispatcher* dispatcher);
00114 
00115         virtual void*   removeOverlappingPair(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0,btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1,btDispatcher* dispatcher);
00116         
00117         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool needsBroadphaseCollision(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0,btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1) const
00118         {
00119                 if (m_overlapFilterCallback)
00120                         return m_overlapFilterCallback->needBroadphaseCollision(proxy0,proxy1);
00121 
00122                 bool collides = (proxy0->m_collisionFilterGroup & proxy1->m_collisionFilterMask) != 0;
00123                 collides = collides && (proxy1->m_collisionFilterGroup & proxy0->m_collisionFilterMask);
00124                 
00125                 return collides;
00126         }
00127 
00128         // Add a pair and return the new pair. If the pair already exists,
00129         // no new pair is created and the old one is returned.
00130         virtual btBroadphasePair*       addOverlappingPair(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0,btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1)
00131         {
00132                 gAddedPairs++;
00133 
00134                 if (!needsBroadphaseCollision(proxy0,proxy1))
00135                         return 0;
00136 
00137                 return internalAddPair(proxy0,proxy1);
00138         }
00139 
00140         
00141 
00142         void    cleanProxyFromPairs(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy,btDispatcher* dispatcher);
00143 
00144         
00145         virtual void    processAllOverlappingPairs(btOverlapCallback*,btDispatcher* dispatcher);
00146 
00147         virtual btBroadphasePair*       getOverlappingPairArrayPtr()
00148         {
00149                 return &m_overlappingPairArray[0];
00150         }
00151 
00152         const btBroadphasePair* getOverlappingPairArrayPtr() const
00153         {
00154                 return &m_overlappingPairArray[0];
00155         }
00156 
00157         btBroadphasePairArray&  getOverlappingPairArray()
00158         {
00159                 return m_overlappingPairArray;
00160         }
00161 
00162         const btBroadphasePairArray&    getOverlappingPairArray() const
00163         {
00164                 return m_overlappingPairArray;
00165         }
00166 
00167         void    cleanOverlappingPair(btBroadphasePair& pair,btDispatcher* dispatcher);
00168 
00169 
00170 
00171         btBroadphasePair* findPair(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0, btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1);
00172 
00173         int GetCount() const { return m_overlappingPairArray.size(); }
00174 //      btBroadphasePair* GetPairs() { return m_pairs; }
00175 
00176         btOverlapFilterCallback* getOverlapFilterCallback()
00177         {
00178                 return m_overlapFilterCallback;
00179         }
00180 
00181         void setOverlapFilterCallback(btOverlapFilterCallback* callback)
00182         {
00183                 m_overlapFilterCallback = callback;
00184         }
00185 
00186         int     getNumOverlappingPairs() const
00187         {
00188                 return m_overlappingPairArray.size();
00189         }
00190 private:
00191         
00192         btBroadphasePair*       internalAddPair(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0,btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1);
00193 
00194         void    growTables();
00195 
00196         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool equalsPair(const btBroadphasePair& pair, int proxyId1, int proxyId2)
00197         {       
00198                 return pair.m_pProxy0->getUid() == proxyId1 && pair.m_pProxy1->getUid() == proxyId2;
00199         }
00200 
00201         /*
00202         // Thomas Wang's hash, see: http://www.concentric.net/~Ttwang/tech/inthash.htm
00203         // This assumes proxyId1 and proxyId2 are 16-bit.
00204         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE int getHash(int proxyId1, int proxyId2)
00205         {
00206                 int key = (proxyId2 << 16) | proxyId1;
00207                 key = ~key + (key << 15);
00208                 key = key ^ (key >> 12);
00209                 key = key + (key << 2);
00210                 key = key ^ (key >> 4);
00211                 key = key * 2057;
00212                 key = key ^ (key >> 16);
00213                 return key;
00214         }
00215         */
00216 
00217 
00218         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE unsigned int getHash(unsigned int proxyId1, unsigned int proxyId2)
00219         {
00220                 unsigned int key = proxyId1 | (proxyId2 << 16);
00221                 // Thomas Wang's hash
00222 
00223                 key += ~(key << 15);
00224                 key ^=  (key >> 10);
00225                 key +=  (key << 3);
00226                 key ^=  (key >> 6);
00227                 key += ~(key << 11);
00228                 key ^=  (key >> 16);
00229                 return key;
00230         }
00231         
00232 
00233 
00234         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE btBroadphasePair* internalFindPair(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0, btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1, int hash)
00235         {
00236                 int proxyId1 = proxy0->getUid();
00237                 int proxyId2 = proxy1->getUid();
00238                 #if 0 // wrong, 'equalsPair' use unsorted uids, copy-past devil striked again. Nat.
00239                 if (proxyId1 > proxyId2) 
00240                         btSwap(proxyId1, proxyId2);
00241                 #endif
00242 
00243                 int index = m_hashTable[hash];
00244                 
00245                 while( index != BT_NULL_PAIR && equalsPair(m_overlappingPairArray[index], proxyId1, proxyId2) == false)
00246                 {
00247                         index = m_next[index];
00248                 }
00249 
00250                 if ( index == BT_NULL_PAIR )
00251                 {
00252                         return NULL;
00253                 }
00254 
00255                 btAssert(index < m_overlappingPairArray.size());
00256 
00257                 return &m_overlappingPairArray[index];
00258         }
00259 
00260         virtual bool    hasDeferredRemoval()
00261         {
00262                 return false;
00263         }
00264 
00265         virtual void    setInternalGhostPairCallback(btOverlappingPairCallback* ghostPairCallback)
00266         {
00267                 m_ghostPairCallback = ghostPairCallback;
00268         }
00269 
00270         virtual void    sortOverlappingPairs(btDispatcher* dispatcher);
00271         
00272 
00273         
00274 };

00281 class   btSortedOverlappingPairCache : public btOverlappingPairCache
00282 {
00283         protected:
00284                 //avoid brute-force finding all the time
00285                 btBroadphasePairArray   m_overlappingPairArray;
00286 
00287                 //during the dispatch, check that user doesn't destroy/create proxy
00288                 bool            m_blockedForChanges;
00289 
00291                 bool            m_hasDeferredRemoval;
00292                 
00293                 //if set, use the callback instead of the built in filter in needBroadphaseCollision
00294                 btOverlapFilterCallback* m_overlapFilterCallback;
00295 
00296                 btOverlappingPairCallback*      m_ghostPairCallback;
00297 
00298         public:
00299                         
00300                 btSortedOverlappingPairCache(); 
00301                 virtual ~btSortedOverlappingPairCache();
00302

00304 
00305                 void*   removeOverlappingPair(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0,btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1,btDispatcher* dispatcher);
00306

00310

00312                         
00313

00315 
00316                 void    removeOverlappingPairsContainingProxy(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy,btDispatcher* dispatcher);
00317 
00318 
00319                 inline bool needsBroadphaseCollision(btBroadphaseProxy* proxy0,btBroadphaseProxy* proxy1) const
00320                 {
00321                         if (m_overlapFilterCallback)
00322                                 return m_overlapFilterCallback->needBroadphaseCollision(proxy0,proxy1);
00323 
00324                         bool collides = (proxy0->m_collisionFilterGroup & proxy1->m_collisionFilterMask) != 0;
00325                         collides = collides && (proxy1->m_collisionFilterGroup & proxy0->m_collisionFilterMask);
00326                         
00327                         return collides;
00328                 }
00329                 
00330                 btBroadphasePairArray&  getOverlappingPairArray()
00331                 {
00332                         return m_overlappingPairArray;
00333                 }
00334 
00335                 const btBroadphasePairArray&    getOverlappingPairArray() const
00336                 {
00337                         return m_overlappingPairArray;
00338                 }
00339 
00340                 
00341

00344                 {
00345                         return &m_overlappingPairArray[0];
00346                 }
00347

00349                 {
00350                         return &m_overlappingPairArray[0];
00351                 }
00352 
00353                 int     getNumOverlappingPairs() const
00354                 {
00355                         return m_overlappingPairArray.size();
00356                 }
00357                 
00358                 btOverlapFilterCallback* getOverlapFilterCallback()
00359                 {
00360                         return m_overlapFilterCallback;
00361                 }
00362 
00363                 void setOverlapFilterCallback(btOverlapFilterCallback* callback)
00364                 {
00365                         m_overlapFilterCallback = callback;
00366                 }
00367 
00368                 virtual bool    hasDeferredRemoval()
00369                 {
00370                         return m_hasDeferredRemoval;
00371                 }
00372

00374                 {
